item.title: Recognizing certain words in a continuous speech
item.dc:creator: AppsDev
item.description:
Hello,

I’m integrating my iOS app with the offline voice recognition functionality, and I wonder if it is possible to recognize some, let’s say, key words while the user is in a conversation, or in the middle of a complete sentence. I mean: for example, I’d like to recognize the word “HELLO” in a phrase or sentence “* HELLO *”, being * whatever the user is saying. I’m only able to detect isolated words between silences, is it possible to do what I’d like to do with this SDK? Could somebody help me to solve this?

Thanks in advance

item.title: Reply To: Recognizing certain words in a continuous speech
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description:
Welcome,

This is basically what Rejecto is for: /rejecto. It allows words which aren’t in the vocabulary to be ignored in a recognition pass so that you can do keyword spotting.
